description.narrative: 1. Strengthening food security: improved availability and cost of high quality fertilizers will help local farmers in Brazil to boost productivity and increase agricultural production. 2. Frontier Regions: Supporting a second tier market leader with operations in frontier regions of Brazil: Cibrafertil is headquartered and has 5 out of 8 plants in Brazil's much needed frontier regions of Brazil (state of Bahia, Goias and Mato Grosso). 3. Job creation: Cibrafertil currently employs around 450 people in Brazil. Implementation of the Project will help Cibrafertil to generate additional 150 jobs. 4. Transfer of technology and know-how: the Project will enable transfer of technical and managerial know-how in the fertilizer manufacturing and distribution sectors, strengthening competitiveness of local famers and contributing to sector growth.

table, .k-table{ border-collapse:collapse; width:100%; table-layout:fixed; margin-bottom: 15px;} .k-table, .k-table td, table, table td {outline: 0;border: 1px solid #000; } .k-table td, table td { padding: 5px; } Cibrafertil - Companhia Brasileira de Fertilizantes (Cibrafértil or the Company), is a family investment business that produces, imports and distributes fertilizers in Brazil. Cibrafértil is the 5th largest fertilizer company in the country (~4% of market share) and operates 8 production, blending and storage facilities with capacity of 1.7 million tons of fertilizer. Cibrafértil employs around 450 people. Cibrafértil was founded in 1994 by a local group and acquired by the Vashisht family in 2012. Main Shareholder is Paribara (99.99%), controlled by the Vashisht family (Neha Vashisht (30%), Niti Vashisht (30%), Ashu Vashisht (20%) and Naresh Vashisht (20%) - the Family), citizens of the United States. The Family has a long history of successful investments, with Omimex Group in the United States and fertilizers in Latin America with Grupo Abocol.
